parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular

str2: A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: From para and tithemi; to place alongside, i.e. Present; by implication, to deposit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
